intro: Astropanax barteri, commonly known as the Barter's ginseng, is a rare and endangered plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive. Its botanical features make it a unique subject of study in plant ecology and medicinal botany.
